summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) documenting a call with an attorney. The attorney's client, a female individual, confirmed she was not involved in negotiating the 2007 non-prosecution agreement (NPA) between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (USAO-SDFL), and first learned about it and her inclusion in it from media reports.

persons.name: Drescher, Sunny
persons.role: Contractor at U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Appears as the recipient or possibly the sender of the email chain; associated with USAO-SDNY.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the 2007 non-prosecution agreement (NPA) negotiated with federal prosecutors.

connections.description: The unnamed female client was included as a subject in the non-prosecution agreement negotiated for Epstein, though she claims no prior knowledge or involvement.

events.title: Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement Negotiation
events.description: A non-prosecution agreement (NPA) was negotiated between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (USAO-SDFL).

events.title: Attorney Call Regarding NPA Knowledge
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys spoke with an attorney whose client confirmed she was not involved in negotiating the 2007 Epstein NPA and first learned of it from media reports.

locations: One Saint Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: An unnamed female individual, represented by an attorney, was included as a subject in the 2007 non-prosecution agreement between Jeffrey Epstein and federal prosecutors.
This individual confirmed she was not involved in negotiating the agreement and was unaware of its existence or her inclusion in it at the time.
She first learned about the NPA and her name being in it when it was reported in the media, indicating a lack of prior knowledge or consent.
The communication is an internal note documenting this claim, created by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in October 2021.
The document is subject to a protective order, restricting the disclosure of certain paragraphs.
